com.sap.cloud.sdk.datamodel.odata.helper

Class FluentHelperCount

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sap.cloud.sdk.datamodel.odata.helper.FluentHelperCount

  • public class FluentHelperCount
extends Object
    Representation of an OData query for count, as a fluent interface for further configuring the request and executing it.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        @Deprecated
public long execute(@Nonnull
                                HttpDestinationProperties destination)
                         throws com.sap.cloud.sdk.odatav2.connectivity.ODataException
        Deprecated. Use the improved method executeRequest(HttpDestinationProperties) instead.
        Executes the underlying query for count, using the stored values, plus any query modifiers that were previously called.
        Parameters:
        destination - Supply the destination for executing the underlying OData query.
        Returns:
        The number of tuples that match the criteria specified in the query.
        Throws:
        com.sap.cloud.sdk.odatav2.connectivity.ODataException - If the execution of the command failed.

      • executeRequest

        public long executeRequest(@Nonnull
                           HttpDestinationProperties destination)
        Executes the underlying query for count, using the stored values, plus any query modifiers that were previously called. This is an alternative to execute(HttpDestinationProperties). Contrary to execute(HttpDestinationProperties) this operation does not request the service metadata before performing the actual request. As a consequence FluentHelperBasic.withoutCachingMetadata() and FluentHelperBasic.cachingMetadata() have no effect on this operation. Furthermore, error handlers registered via FluentHelperRead.withErrorHandler(ErrorResultHandler) will not be respected.
        Parameters:
        destination - The target system this request should be issued against.
        Returns:
        The number of tuples that match the criteria specified in the query.
        Throws:
        DestinationAccessException - If there is an issue accessing the HttpDestination.
        HttpClientInstantiationException - If there is an issue creating the HttpClient.
        ODataException - If the OData request execution failed. Please find the documentation for ODataException possible sub-types and error scenarios they can occur in.

      • toRequest

        @Beta
 @Nonnull
public ODataRequestCount toRequest()
        Creates an instance of ODataRequestCount.

        The following settings are used:

        • the endpoint URL
        • the entity collection name
        • the OData query
        Returns:
        A new count request with the given configuraiton.

      • withCsrfToken

        @Beta
 @Nonnull
public FluentHelperCount withCsrfToken()
        Activates the CSRF token retrieval for this OData request. This is useful if the server does require CSRF tokens as part of the request.
        Returns:
        The same builder
